sections.heading: Reasons Linux is Popular
paragraphs: Linux is widely used because it combines power, flexibility, and cost-effectiveness.
Its open-source nature allows constant improvements from a global community.
bullets: Free & Open Source ✅ — No license fees, and anyone can modify and share it.
Stability & Reliability ✅ — Rarely crashes; servers can run for years without rebooting.
Security ✅ — Fewer viruses and strong user permission system.
Performance ✅ — Runs efficiently, even on older hardware.
Flexibility ✅ — Works on devices from supercomputers to Raspberry Pi.

sections.heading: What Can You Do with Linux?
rows: Smart home gadgets, Raspberry Pi projects

sections.heading: Key Terms
rows: Ability to run continuously without crashing
Rules for who can access files and programs
Ability to work in many environments and devices
People who contribute and improve Linux software

sections.text: 96% of the world’s top 1 million servers run Linux!

bullets: Linux is free, stable, secure, high-performance, and flexible.
It’s ideal for servers, development, IoT devices, and supercomputers.
The open-source community keeps Linux evolving and improving.
